intro: Verbascum myrthense, commonly known as the Myrtle mullein, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, velvety leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy perennial in suitable climates. Its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators make it a popular choice for gardens.
